title: Rek'Sai Tunnels
body: WHy are Rek'Sai's tunnels visible to the enemy team even if they are in the fog war? This limits his ult use A LOT almost never will you be able to use it cause the enemy team can see them on the map even in the fog of war so no hiding one near drag or in a bush cause the enemy will just walk over and step on them. At least make it so you can't seem them in fog of war... Or the amount of times rek'sai will actually use his ult is like once a game.

Second, are they seriously visible in the fog of war? So you can see them anywhere AND they can be destroyed? Anti-bueno.

Also, ally+enemy portals look identical on the minimap, so you don't even know whos is whos.

You said "unless you see them genitals".

Since Rek'Sai doesn't talk, she can't refer to herself as she. That's why her creators do it for her. And since she doesn't have a human voice, it won't be feminine or masculine.

Intent is that the tunnels are visible through fog of war once you've seen them once. Goal there is to make it possible to hide tunnels for future use while also ensuring enemies are able to track tunnel locations once they've discovered them.

I don't think it's necesarry to have them marked once seen.
If people can't remember where the tunnle was and don't sweep the map, it's their own fault.
Going with that we could also make wards visible on the minimap if u see where they were placed...

For a long time in testing the tunnels were only visible on the minimap when you had direct sight of them. One of the problems we ran into at that point was that play testers were really struggling to shutdown Rek'Sai's movement. We really liked the sort of plays she was able to pull off with a large, well placed tunnel network however, so opted to make the tunnels a bit easier to track and potentially stomp rather than reducing tunnel lifespan, maximum number, distance etc.

The thing I am slightly concerned about is that as people get better at playing against her and realizing what they have to do to beat her, having the tunnels marked will make it a bit too hard for her to make good use of the ult. I'm uncertain if playtesting is enough to really establish that kind of experience where people will take good actions to counter her. I obviously do not know the extent of testing, so I can not say that for sure, but it does kind of seem that way a bit.

Yeah, that's something we'll need to monitor as people get better at her, particularly given we don't have much in the way of similar skills in LoL to use as reference points and internal testing can only do so much. On the flip side people will also get better at placing tunnels, hiding them especially, as they play her, so there should be some counteracting effects there.
Really good similar example: Pink ward placement. The ways people use pink wards has gotten a LOT smarter as time goes on, which was very clearly notable when following the S4 LCS.

This. I still recall the time when I hated the pink ward changes to being visible at all times, but then I started noticing how they could essentially act as permanent wards if placed in the right spots and I've loved them ever since.
Great example, and yeah, we'd be very happy to see tunnel placement follow the same sort of trajectory pink ward placement has.
What do you think about being able to place only one end of the tunnel for the sake of  ulting? I feel the double ones are hard to hide.

If the tunnels will stay showing on the minimap, it would be nice to have some tunnel protection (ex. destroying a tunnel gives a short slow).  Standing on it for 1.5 secs is barely even noticeable from all the videos I've watched on her so far. 

Also give that underground Q a slow, even if you have to remove the reveal part.  :D
Please please please!!! Consider taking a look at her tunels in Dominion before release. She may be really broken there! Please!!!
Unfortunately Riot doesn't give a damn about Dominion. What do they care if another utterly broken champion dominates the game there?

I know the other game modes are not considered when designing a champion or... well, ever actually.

But I and others quite enjoy them, whether it's Dominion, ARAM or Treeline.

How do you believe her tunnels being visible at all times and destructible will affect her usage on those maps? Cause right now, I can see her being pretty okay on Scar, but useless on Abyss. It's a division of free-roam compared to extremely confined movement; opposite paradigms to say the least. In addition, I don't see her doing well on TT because so much of her power budget appears to be claimed by the "tacticalness" of her R. But then, she can already jump over (or I guess, dig under) walls. 

Her "I can theoretically return to any point I've been to previously" doesn't matter nearly as much on the smaller maps, and especially on Abyss where the enemy literally walks over every point of ground to to reach the frontlines. The only times it could be useful is diving far behind the turrets and nestling it against the NW or SE base walls, or during the exceptionally late-game scenarios when death timers win or lose games.

Can you guys do something about the colors of her tunnels?  When there are two Rek'Sai on the map, tracking which tunnel is yours and hers can be confusing, especially if you need to get somewhere quick thinking you have a tunnel on the map only to realize it wasn't yours at all.

This is the same for the minimap.  Having both sets be purple circles is just a confusing mess.

Team specific mini map colors for tunnels will be in by the time she launches, we're just sorting out a few code issues with that at the moment. 

As far as the tunnels themselves go there are team indicators on them (color of mist emerging from them). I get the impression from your post those are too hard to read at the moment though?

I know, probably not going to happen as it would be too confusing, *but* it would be kind of fun to be able to use the enemy's tunnels as well as your own. It'd add a bit of adventure to the matchup. Click on a tunnel and not knowing where you will come out. Makes for some good memory games as well and whether or not you decide to destroy the tunnels, or leave it for your own use as well and maybe just stick a ward on either end.

OFA: Mirror Mode on the Rift with Rek'Sai.

I can't even comprehend how horribly awesome it could end up being if you got to use your enemies' tunnels.
Ulti anyone?

Actually both.  I wasn't even aware the color of the mist was different.  I was just looking at the little colored bar above them, which is what the problem sorta kinda is.  It's little, so when things are hectic it's hard to notice which one is yours at a glance.

That's in contrast to say, Karthus' Wall of Pain.  You guys did good indicating which wall is the enemies and I can, at a glance, know whether to run through it or not.

Keep in mind, my complaints are directed towards those hectic in-the-moment situations.  Everything else about her is fun.
